item.title: Information types
item.description: Information Types: # The type of information can be distinguished by process, structure concept, principle, fact, and classification. item.title: Good vs bad design
item.description: Good Vs. Bad Design: # Design can be evaluated by clarity, consistency, and understanding the user’s goals. Designers should stay consistent with their content, ensuring that the information is legible and stays within the topic category. Avoid Ambiguity: # Use clear information displays and test your design to ensure that all users understand the display in the same way. Where ambiguity is avoidable, use standards or conventions to resolve it, and stay uniform.
